----- Original Message -----
From: "Vincent D.Murphy" <vdm@...>

> > For example if I remember correctly
> > HTML forms can only submit POST and GET requests,
>
> correct.
Pedantically, HTML FORM can have method='PUT' - it's the client (i.e.
browser) that does or does not recognize it.

> with javascript on the client, you can use an XmlHttpRequest object (at
> least i think thats what its called; *weird* name, why not just
> 'HttpRequest'?) to send a PUT or DELETE.
The MS interfaces define DOM and XML aware methods on the component, hence
the 'Xml' part. It isn't purely content agnostic.
